params.name: activityIds
params.doc:
Id of external activity that can be either resource or action id. Useful in cases when there is only
 one activity per resource and there is no need to create resource, so instead resource id is assigned
 to external activity id in order to manually delete the activity later.

docs.summary:
Cancels the activity by removing it. When resource is removed, all it's activities are removed along with it,
 but when there are activities that are created without resource then the only way to remove them is through this endpoint.
 The endpoint takes the external_activity_id that was used to create the activity.

params.name: resourceIds
params.doc: Ids of resources that will be deleted.

docs.summary:
Create or update a resource to be a container for member updates. Resource can be i.e. a forum category, a blog post, a comment etc.
 Creating a resource is optional, but important for tracking hierarchy of objects.

params.name: resourceId
params.doc: Id of resource that will have it's subscribers listed

params.name: paging
params.doc: CursorPaging details to define how many subscribers per page and which page to provide

params.name: readToken
params.doc: Read token containing time when write operation occurred, will used database read replica if enough time elapsed.

docs.summary: List identities that are subscribed to resources by previously marking them as seen or read

params.name: resourceFqdn
params.doc: Type of the resource which should be listed

params.name: paging
params.doc: CursorPaging details to define how many resources per page and which page to provide

params.name: readToken
params.doc: Read token containing time when write operation occurred, will used database read replica if enough time elapsed.

params.name: resourceType
params.doc: Type of the resource which should be listed

docs.summary: List resources that belong to tenant which are sorted by provided order.

params.name: resourceIds
params.doc: Ids of resource which should have their resources listed

params.name: readToken
params.doc: Read token containing time when write operation occurred, will used database read replica if enough time elapsed.

docs.summary: List information if identity has seen or read the resource activities.

params.name: readUntilTimestamp
params.doc: Marks all resource changes as read that happened until given timestamp.

docs.summary:
Mark activity updates of all resources as read for identity. Activities that occurred until given timestamp are marked as read.
 It will auto-subscribe the user if no subscription exists yet.

operations.name: Mark Children Of Resource As Read

params.name: resourceId
params.doc: Id of resource that consists of id in any format and resource type

params.name: readUntilTimestamp
params.doc: Marks children resource changes as read that happened until given timestamp.

docs.summary:
Mark activity updates of a resource children as read for identity. Activities that occurred until given timestamp are marked as read.
 It will auto-subscribe the user if no subscription exists yet.

operations.name: Mark Resource As Read For Identities

params.name: resourceId
params.doc: Id of resource that will be marked as read for identities

params.name: identitiesToSubscribe
params.doc: Identities that will acknowledge that have read the resource

params.name: readTimestamp
params.doc: Time when the read action occurred

docs.summary: Mark activity updates of a resource as read for identities. Activities that occurred until given timestamp are marked as read.

params.name: ids
params.doc: Resource id which will be marked as read by identity.

params.name: readTimestamp
params.doc: Marks resource changes as read that happened until given timestamp.

docs.summary:
Mark activity updates of a resource as read for identity. Activities that occurred until given timestamp are marked as read.
 It will auto-subscribe the user if no subscription exists yet.

params.name: ids
params.doc: Resource ids which will be marked as seen by identity.

params.name: seenTimestamp
params.doc: Marks resource changes as seen that happened until given timestamp.

docs.summary:
Mark activity updates of a resource as seen for identity. Activities that occurred until given timestamp are marked as seen.
 It will auto-subscribe the user if no subscription exists yet.

params.name: ids
params.doc: Resource ids which will be marked as unread by identity.

params.name: unreadTimestamp
params.doc: Marks timestamp when unread action occurred.

docs.summary:
Mark activity updates of a resource as unread for identity. This will unread all activity updates that belong to a resource.
 It will auto-subscribe the user if no subscription exists yet.

params.name: resourceId
params.doc: Id of resource that should be resetted for subscriber

params.name: identitiesToSubscribe
params.doc: Subscribers that should have their subscriptions resetted

docs.summary: Reset subscribers to a resource. I.e. in case resource visibility has changed.

params.name: activity
params.doc: Update action that happened to resource at specific point in time

docs.summary:
Submit a member update for a resource. Member update can be i.e. forum or blog post's create, like, report and etc.
 By providing external_activity_id it's possible to submit update for a resource
 that does not exist in this service, thus avoiding additional overhead of having a resource when there is only
 a single activity through the lifetime of resource.

Subscribe to activity updates of a tenant resources. Without subscription to activity updates, it's not possible
 to receive read and seen statuses of resources.

params.name: resourceIds
params.doc: Resources with matching ids will be subscribed to.

params.name: resourceSelector
params.doc: Resources with matching selector within the resource tree.

docs.summary:
Unsubscribe from activity updates of a tenant resources. Without subscription to activity updates, it's not possible
 to receive read and seen statuses of resources.

params.name: resource
params.doc: New information about resource

params.name: visibilityTags
params.doc: Visibility tags that users will have to possess in order to see the tags.

params.name: fields
params.doc: Fields that should be updated

docs.summary:
Create or update a resource to be a container for member updates. Resource can be i.e. a forum category, a blog post, a comment etc.
 Creating a resource is optional, but important for tracking hierarchy of objects.

members.name: id
members.doc: Id of a resource that can be of any format

members.name: resourceType
members.doc: Defines the type of the resource

members.name: id
members.doc: Id of resource that has it's status defined

members.name: read
members.doc: Status that defines if resource is read

members.name: new
members.doc: Status that defines if resource is new

members.name: lastActivityBeforeMemberCreated
members.doc: Status that defines if resource last activity was before member was created

members.name: id
members.doc: Resource id that consists of id of any format and resource type

members.name: parentId
members.doc: Resource id of parent resource

members.name: createTimestamp
members.doc: Time when the resource was created

members.name: resourceId
members.doc: Resource id that consists of id of any format and resource type

members.name: externalId
members.doc:
Id of external activity that can be either resource or action id. Useful in cases when there is only
 one activity per resource and there is no need to create resource, so instead resource id is assigned
 to external activity id in order to manually delete the activity later.

members.name: createTimestamp
members.doc: Time when the resource was created

members.name: matchingResourceTypes
members.doc: Required. Only matching resources with the following resource types will be subscribed to.

members.name: matchingAnyVisibilityTags
members.doc: Optional. Only resource with defined visibility tags will be subscribed to.

members.name: id
members.doc: Id of the external activity, can be a resource id or id tied to action

members.name: visitorId
members.doc: Identity of a site visitor

members.name: memberId
members.doc: Identity of a site member

members.name: userId
members.doc: Identity of a site user

members.name: service
members.doc: Identity of a service

members.name: externalApp
members.doc: Identity of a external application

members.name: paths
members.doc: The set of field mask paths.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Maximum number of items to return in the results.

members.name: cursor
members.doc:
Pointer to the next or previous page in the list of results.

Pass the relevant cursor token from the `pagingMetadata` object in the previous call's response.
Not relevant for the first request.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Offset that was requested.

members.name: total
members.doc: Total number of items that match the query. Returned if offset paging is used and the `tooManyToCount` flag is not set.

members.name: tooManyToCount
members.doc: Flag that indicates the server failed to calculate the `total` field.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Cursors to navigate through the result pages using `next` and `prev`. Returned if cursor paging is used.

members.name: next
members.doc: Cursor string pointing to the next page in the list of results.

members.name: prev
members.doc: Cursor pointing to the previous page in the list of results.
